title: The Fan
occurrences: One mother-of-pearl box, inlaid, containing a fan.
I have no intention of biding. Why should I? It's my own fan.
Whatever are talking about? The fan is mine.
- How do I know the fan is yours? - Well, I... I told you so.
- Have you got a bill for this fan? - Of course not, it was a gift.
You'll find me always cheerful and willing to oblige. I'll put the fan aside for a day.
If it hadn't been for the fan, I wouldn't have dreamed of looking you up.
unless I bring in someone who knows me and knows about the fan.
What idiots? Bring in where? What fan?
Why, Lady Windermere's fan!
I'm entirely persuaded. I shall take the fan.
You should have your wife's name on the fan to make it more personal.
my idea of having rubies on the fan should be worth ten pounds more.
Not when I want something, and I want my fan, Robert.
Come and verify my statement and then I can have my fan back.
And your fan, what a lovely thing! A birthday present?
My fan! They found my fan!
- Show him the fan! - What fan?
It's my wife's fan, there can't be any mistake.
Arthur, I assure you I have no idea how that fan got here.
Here, take my fan and leave the rest to me.
I'm so sorry, I think I left my fan here.
Well, isn't that stupid of me? This is Lady Windermere's fan.
I slept in the study. Have any of you found a fan? Someone left it here.
A fan? I don't think so, m'lord. At least, not yet.
and her grace, the Duchess of Berwick left a galosh, but I've seen no fan.
Very well. Try and find the fan.
It was fan, my Lord. Her ladyship had me put it in a small box for her.
Here, I came to give you back your fan and I've forgotten to do it.
The fan. You know, the fan you found at the auction.
I shall be so happy to have the fan again.
and her fan in the mother-of-pearl box, the fan with her name on it.
